task.title: Processing to Eclipse help targets using Eclipse

prolog.author: Richard Johnson
Anna van Raaphorst
prolog.publisher: OASIS (Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards)

taskbody.prereq: This topic assumes you are already familiar with the Eclipse environment and know how to develop Eclipse plug-ins.
taskbody.context: This topic assumes you want to author DITA topics making up an Eclipse help plug-in using Eclipse to both edit and build the content.

step.cmd: Start Eclipse and create a new Eclipse plug-in development project.
Apply the DITA template to the new project. This causes the template wizard to start.

ul.li: the name of any customized CSS file
the name of any ditaval file

step.stepresult: The main DITA map will be created in the source directory and build.xml will be created in the root directory.

step.cmd: Edit one or more DITA topic files in the source directory.
Update the DITA map file to include the topics created.
Select build.xml and run it with Ant.
step.stepresult: The DITA output should now be in the output directory.

step.cmd: Edit the plug-in description in the plug-in editor, referring to the TOC files generated in the output directory.
Update the build property file to include all the output files.
Export the output files to a document plug-in.
